title: Burglary
summary: Burglary, also called breaking and entering[1] and sometimes housebreaking,[2] is illegally entering a building or other areas to commit a crime. Usually that offence is theft, robbery or murder, but most jurisdictions include others within the ambit of burglary. To commit burglary is to burgle,[3] a term back-formed from the word burglar, or to burglarize.[4][3]
